Barton Center For Diabetes Education

The Barton Center for Diabetes Education is a renowned institution that has been providing comprehensive diabetes education and support for over 80 years. Located in North Oxford, Massachusetts, the center is dedicated to empowering individuals with diabetes to live healthy and fulfilling lives.

One of the key aspects that sets the Barton Center apart is its focus on education. The center offers a wide range of programs and resources for individuals of all ages, from children to adults. These programs cover various aspects of diabetes management, including nutrition, exercise, medication management, and emotional well-being. The center's team of experienced healthcare professionals and educators work closely with each individual to develop personalized plans that meet their unique needs and goals.

In addition to its educational programs, the Barton Center also provides a supportive community for individuals with diabetes. The center hosts various events and activities throughout the year, including summer camps for children and teens with diabetes. These camps offer a safe and nurturing environment where campers can learn valuable skills for managing their diabetes while also enjoying traditional camp activities like swimming, hiking, and arts and crafts. The center also offers support groups and workshops for adults, providing a space for individuals to connect with others who understand the challenges of living with diabetes.

The Barton Center for Diabetes Education is truly a beacon of hope for individuals with diabetes and their families. Through its comprehensive educational programs and supportive community, the center empowers individuals to take control of their diabetes and live their best lives. Whether you are newly diagnosed or have been living with diabetes for years, the Barton Center is there to provide the knowledge, resources, and support you need to thrive.
